page.title: 10EASSIE CHILDREN'S PASTIMES
page.content: We found that the most popular games played at school were football, British bulldog, high tig, rounders, net-ball, skipping and marbles. Many children belonged to Guides, Brownies, Cubs or Scouts.Meetings are held in Glamis, three miles away. Boys favourite spare-time activities include fishing, cycling, swimming, helping on the farms and model-making. Girls enjoyed cycling, making doll's clothes, cooking and looking after their pets. Both groups read and watch television a great deal in wintertime.They earn pocket money fruit-picking and potato- harvesting. Many of the children own their own ponies and spend a great deal of time riding, grooming and showing them.
